$interpreted: Morris: Still can't stabilize the energy...
Morris: ...but the conference is nearing. If we delay the conference, then funding will be an issue...
Morris: ...Am I really that far off...?
Aosta: Professor Dietrich.
Morris: Clovis, I don't like being disturbed.
Aosta: Sorry to bother you, but I have an important issue to report.
Morris: I'm busy. Tell me tomorrow.
Clio: Professor, while we were organizing the research materials in your office, we discovered a student was eavesdropping.
Morris: ...Eavesdropping?
Aosta: Yes. We were afraid she would steal your research. We grabbed her so you could deal with accordingly.
Morris: Tell me who you are and why you were spying. You have one minute.
Barbara: Yes...I...I'm sorry, Professor Dietrich.
Clio: Professor, her name is Barbara. She's a freshman...
Morris: And she is speech-impaired?
Clio: No, she's...
Morris: Then let her speak.
Clio: Yes, sir. You, tell Professor what he needs.
Barbara: I am a freshman. My name is Barbara Balzac. I study Applied Magic...I'm sorry to disturb you.
Morris: Ah, another monkey. Well, what business do you have with me?
Barbara: This morning, at the conference, I saw you stop the device when it got out of control and it got me really interested in Life Magic.
Barbara: I mean, I really wanted to just wait for your presentation, but I just couldn't help myself...
Aosta: Fool! Professor Dietrich's invaluable research is not something you can just pick up on a whim!
Morris: ...Now, now, Clovis.
Morris: A person with ambition who is willing to take action, this I cannot disprove of. Now then, what have you learned?
Barbara: Uh, I didn't hear much...
Morris: Don't be shy. Let's hear what you've learned!
Barbara: I didn't understand a word...I'm sorry.
Morris: Not a surprise...
Barbara: Amazing...what is this...power?
Morris: Life Magic inquires deep into the origin of the Soul. Mere eavesdropping will get you nowhere.
Morris: Only by attaining practical experience can you learn the truth.
Barbara: Thank...thank you for the advice, Professor!
Clio: Professor Dietrich, you...
Morris: What did I say? Practical experience.
Morris: Little monkey, you must put all your energy into this, or else...
Barbara: Or else...what?
Morris: Oh, you can't be lacking in imagination.
Morris: Hah! So this is all you got even after an enhancement?
Morris: What a shame. Get the hell out.
Barbara: Professor...
Morris: ...Wait.
Clio: Demon Vine...Aqua Crystals...Tana Root...
Clio: Professor Dietrich, these ingredients are...
Morris: They will allow me to advance my research further.
Morris: Little monkey, if you help them gather these materials, then I'll make an exception and teach you a thing or two.
Barbara: But Professor, from what I understand, there are certain materials on the list that the Academy forbids students from picking themselves...
Clio: Sister, "If you break a rule and nobody sees it, then it never happened." Words from Professor Dietrich himself.
Morris: You talk too much.
Morris: Well, if you don't want to help, then get out.
Barbara: ...I understand. I will help.
Aosta: Then we shall excuse ourselves.
Aosta: Let's go.
Morris: With Clovis there, it shouldn't be an issue. I sure know how to use mediocre talent...hehe...
Morris: If Ceres knew of this, what would he think?
